oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roche Gilbert du Motier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Full length portrait engraving of Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roche Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette. Depicted seated, in uniform, with table, drum, and hat in background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Generals; Portraits; Engravings; Uniforms; Soldiers
Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert Du Motier, -- marquis de, -- 1757-1834.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: French soldier, statesman, and liberal leader, Lafayette was a general in the American Revolutionary army and a close friend of George Washington. He was at Valley Forge during the hard winter of 1777-1778. Lafayette was only twenty years old when Congress commissioned him a major general.
